intro: Triticum spelta subsp. kuckuckianum, commonly known as the cuckoo wheat, is a rare and ancient grain species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, spike-like inflorescence and small, pale blue or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is native to Central and Eastern Europe. Its seeds are used in traditional baking and are valued for their nutritional content and unique flavor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
